title: Tyson Fury ideally suited to crazy world of wrestling
text:
As Tyson Fury jumped the hoardings to pick a scrap with WWE’s heavyweight professional wrestler Braun Strowman last week, the boxer crossed into a lucrative new world.

As ever with pro wrestling, Fury’s inception into the WWE as heavyweight boxing’s “big bad Gypsy King” – for which he will earn a cool $12 million (£9.42 million) for a minimum three appearances on the circuit – followed a pre-written script, despite the pretence of it having been agreed on the hoof. Instead, overtures had been made and Fury signed up long ago.

It is a mark of Fury’s standing in the United States that he was deemed big enough to pursue. Of boxing’s greats, only Mike Tyson and Floyd Mayweather Jr have previously...
description: As Tyson Fury jumped the hoardings to pick a scrap with WWE’s heavyweight professional wrestler Braun Strowman last week, the boxer crossed into a lucrative new world.
